turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Why didn't you cremate him?!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: They were gonna!  But some asshole sent a lot of money to give Jason and his mother a decent burial. Now look, you just lie down and get some rest.  In the morning I'll call that clinic and see if they...

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: If you'd just go to the cemetery, you'll see I'm not lying.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Either you go to sleep or I'll come in there and put you out.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: You're gonna be sorry you didn't listen to me.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: You're gonna be sorry if you don't shut the fuck up.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: I sympathize with you kids.  The best I can do is call the station in Carpenter and have them keep a lookout for them.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I got a bad feeling of what might've happened to them.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: No!...  ... You kids better leave.  This boy here is not well and I need to talk to him in private.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: I was going to call the clinic and have them collect your ass.  But I don't want you around here any longer poisoning my daughter, or anyone else, with your warped mind.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: But they have to be warned, Sheriff.  Jason will return to the area that's familiar.  No matter what you call it, it's still Camp Crystal Lake to him.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I gotta show you Jason's grave.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: I've seen it.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Please, Sheriff.  You'll see we dug it up.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Don't concern yourself, Martin. This boy needs treatment.  We're taking care of it.  Sorry for the disturbance.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Jason's not in his coffin!  Hawes is!  Dig it up!  You gotta dig it up!!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: With extreme car, for God's sake. If that kid is with her, there's every good chance he'll do something crazy.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Please don't do anything crazy.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: You got me where you want me. There's no reason not...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: If I had you where I really wanted you, they'd be pumping your ass full of formaldehyde.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Doesn't that tell you something?!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Yeah...They should've paid their bill.

turns.speaker: CAMPBELL
turns.text: Mr. Duke, how can you claim that Jason Voorhees is not truly dead?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: How many times has Jason been reported killed before, Mr. Campbell?

turns.speaker: CAMPBELL
turns.text: Eight times.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Eight times.  They've burned him, dipped him in nuclear waste --

turns.speaker: CAMPBELL
turns.text: -- But this time they bombed him and then cremated the body.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: They coulda danced a jig on it an' fed it to goats -- don't matter.  Ya' can't kill Jason by gettin' rid of his body.  He'll come back the way he always do, to drag the kiddies into the darkness and crush their little skulls -- maybe even your skull, Mr. Campbell.

turns.speaker: CAMPBELL
turns.text: Well, let's hope not!

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Yeah, that'd be a big shame...

turns.speaker: CAMPBELL
turns.text: In the media, you've frequently been described as "salty" --

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: -- look, just shut up.  Let's cut through the shit.  You asked me here because you want me to catch and kill Jason Voorhees for ya'.  I'll do it, but it won't be easy...and it won't be cheap.  One hundred grand, non- negotiable.

turns.speaker: CAMPBELL
turns.text: I understand.  However, our audience should be aware that you only charged forty thousand dollars to catch the Idaho skin stretcher.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Skin stretcher was human.

turns.speaker: CAMPBELL
turns.text: Mr. Duke tonight I'm prepared to offer you your sum of one hundred thousand dollars, payable only after you provide American Casefile with incontrovertible proof of --

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: -- yeah, yeah, yeah.  You just have your hundred grand ready.  For that you get the machete...the mask...the whole damn thing.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Diana -- you heard from Jessica lately?

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: ...but there just may not be enough time.  If you still care about her, if you still want to try to make things better between you two...we should talk.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: So let's talk.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: No.  Not here.  Come by my house tonight at eleven.  Don't be late.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: You have to...save...Jessica... Save Jessica and save the...

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Save your...

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Steven...

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: I'm scared.  I'm very scared.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Anything else?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: I know who you are.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: I need to talk to you.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: I'm kind of busy right now...

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: I'm going to kill Jason Voorhees -- and I need you to help me.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Jason Voorhees is dead.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: You know he's not...and he's coming for you.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: You food'll be right out.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: No, I --

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Twenty.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Look --

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Thirty.  Name your price.  Everyone has a price, what's yours?

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Look, I don't want your money!

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Then maybe I should offer it to your daughter...

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: You know what I want.  You know why I need you.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: You need to leave.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: I know everything about you, Diana.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: That's it, we're done.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Everything going okay?

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: It's going.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Legs giving you trouble?

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Not so bad, today.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Steven buggin' you?

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Do you have to ask?

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Ed...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Okay.  So how is Jessica?  You talked to her lately?

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Yeah, she's good, considering. That kid just takes everything in stride.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: I gotta get back to work.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Okay, I'll call you later.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: What's the problem here?

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: N...nothing.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Hello...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: June the 19th.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Jesus!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Sorry, Di.  I was just going to my car.  I didn't mean to frighten you...

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: It's...It's all right.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Listen...don't you worry about Ed. He'll come around.  He's too good a Sheriff to let you give him the slip.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: I'm just too old for going steady, Josh.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: So's he and he knows it.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Everything'll work out.  Trust me on that.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Good night, beautiful.

turns.speaker: DIANA
turns.text: 'Night, Josh.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Maybe you should be moving on.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Maybe you should mind your own business.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Get up!

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Why don't you blow me, Chief.  After your girlfriend gets through.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: You're talking about my lady.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: She's your lady only cause she ain't had a taste of the Duke yet.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Goddamnit!

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Careful, Chief.  I don't think you know who I am.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: I know who you are and the last thing we need around here is some freak show "bounty hunter" making trouble. I want you outta town and I want you outta town now!

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: That's very colorful, chief.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Take him to my car.  I'll be out in a minute.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Where the fuck is she, Duke?!

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: That's what I'd like to know.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Why did you want her body?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: For a good reason.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Tell me!

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Information like that is very expensive and you don't have the balls to pay the price.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Lock this asshole up.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: You think you can lock me up in this piss-ass prison?  Hell, this place is motel fuckin' six to me.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Jessica, I'm so sorry.  I...I wanted to have this cleaned up before you got here.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: That's all right.  I was just...

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: She's beautiful.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Her name's Stephanie.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: She's yours?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I was going to, I was going to tell everyone.  I just...didn't expect to be back here so soon.  Is Steven around?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Does he know about what happened?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Yeah.  Sit down a second.  There's something I need to tell you about Steven...

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Jesus, Steven, that's...that's really lovely.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: I mean, how can you go through life without never having made a prank call?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Hell, when Steven was a kid, he was like, having strippers delivered to church Bingos and shit.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: It was a community service.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Absolutely.  The church even sent me an autographed picture of God.  Ward!

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Showing Vicki what she missed out on by being such a dull kid.  Now, the first thing you need in making a prank call is, of course, a phone.  This one, for instance.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Steven, c'mon, we're not thirteen...

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Next, you dial a number.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: ...and it's now ringing...ringing... and -- Hello? Anthony's Pizzeria? Yeah, this is officer Randy Parker over at the station.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Oh, c'mon, would you stop, please?

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Is this Anthony?...Yeah, well, I just have one question for you, Anthony -- did you fuck my dog?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Oh my God, Steven.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Yeah, well somebody fucked her and if I find out it was you, I'm gonna come over there and shoot you in the head.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: I'm now begging you.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Listen, since I got you on the phone -- ask the guys there if they wanna chip in for a hooker.  I'll send her right over.  Her name is Vicki.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Randy, you dipshit!  Take these off!

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Sorry, I'm working now.  You see, I have a job...

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Randy, c'mon!

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Have a good night.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Wanna know how I did that?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Gotta go.  See you guys later.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I have to bring you to a cell.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Are you crazy?!

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: I know, I know, I'm sorry but the Sheriff is just berserk right now. C'mon.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: I'll be back later.  You just be cool, okay.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Don't do anything stupid.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: What am I gonna do -- I'm locked up in a friggin' cell?!

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: I'm gonna get your outta this.  Just hang tight.  Okay?

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Oh, my dear God...

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: He was dead.  He had to be dead...

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: How many times do you want to hear this?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Until I hear the truth.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: I've told you the truth.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: The truth?  That Josh, a man I've trusted with my own life on more than one occasion -- let me see if I've got the order right here -- tried to rape Diana...got the back of his head blown off...took a poker through the gut...fell through a plate glass window and then magically disappeared into the night.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: I know what it sounds like.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: You don't know shit!

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: I didn't kill her!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Then why were you at her house?!  She didn't want anything to do with you.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: She asked me to come over.  She said she had something to tell me.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: About Jessica.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: That's a lie.  Diana would never talk to you about Jessica.  Not after what you did to her.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Look, I know I treated her bad --

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: -- Bad?!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: You call what you did bad?!  You knocked her up and then left her!

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: No -- she left me!  After her miscarriage, I --

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: -- Miscarriage?!  Who the fuck told you Jessica had a miscarriage?!

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: She did!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: My God...you are one sorry son-of-a- bitch.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: She did have a miscarriage, didn't she?  Didn't she?!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Oh, you stupid, sorry son-of-a- bitch...

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: What do you mean you've never made a prank call?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: You mean never as in really never, or never as in it was just so stupid you don't want to tell us about it?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I mean really never.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: I'm sorry to hear that.  A famous man once said -- there is no worse regret then a temptation resisted.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: That's disgusting.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Disgusting?  Bingo night was sold out for six months after that!  They raised enough money to build a day care center.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Steven!

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: She's a waitress at Joey B's but she needs some extra cash.  Ward's the pimp.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I'm literally going to kill you!

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Ten dollars! Hell, I can't do that to you -- you can have her for a pizza.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: A pizza?!

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: What's going on? I heard on the P.A. system that...

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: The Captain's been murdered. The buzz is that Jason might be on board.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: Jason...Voorhees?

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: Have you seen Tamara?

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: No. And I'm not losing any sleep over it.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: But she might be in trouble...

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: So what else is new?  Look Eva, you're asking the wrong dude to feel sorry for Tamara Mason. Wise up -- it's not hip to be her friend.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: I don't care about being hip anymore.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: I hear the crew members are cute guys in their twenties.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: I'm sure we'll have no problem getting them to party with us...especially with this.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: It's my graduation gift from Daddy. It cost over a thousand bucks but it's the best.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: He bought you that?

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: More or less. It's part of my college fund.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: A major prick.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: Improvise, of course.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: He's undefeated, you know that?  Julius is the only senior I'd even consider doing it with. If he wasn't black, that is.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: My parents are open minded about that sort of thing.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: My stepmom couldn't care less, but Daddy would have a shit fit.  He might even pay some attention to me.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: I think it's time for some recreational activity, girl.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: Sounds good. I hear there's a shuffleboard court on deck -- it might be kinds cool...

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: You're joking, right?

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: What? Don't be a lightweight...this is top dollar toot.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: It's not that, it's just that...  It I get caught, I'll lose my science scholarship and everything.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: You're talking to the prom queen, Eva. Do you really think I'm going to risk getting caught?

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: I guess not.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: Do you realize how many people would kill to be sitting here right now? Come on, it's grad night. You've got your whole life to be uptight.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: A real space cadet. I wonder if she'll narc on us...

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: I have her in Creative Writing and she's fairly nice.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: Nobody related to McCulloch can be nice.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: Relax, I've got McCulloch covered... but that little narcing bitch niece of his is a different matter.  Rumor has it she's a teensy bit afraid of the water...

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: That was truly excellent.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: Time to check out the waiters.

turns.speaker: EVA
turns.text: I think I'll pass. See you later, okay?

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: But...wait a minute!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well...how do you feel?

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: Ask me in about five minutes.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: What murders?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Never mind, you don't want to know about it.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: There's nothing to worry about, Suzy. The guy's dead now, somewhere at the bottom of this lake...if you believe the stories.  Let's drop it, okay?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: I mean, Lakeview High just closed its doors for good, right?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: So there's no reason for him to come back because there won't be any of us around...right?

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: Did you hear that?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hear what?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: All right, all right -- I'm a major ass.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: And you'll never do it again.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: And I'll never do it again. Forgive me?

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Which cabin is Rennie in, Mr. McCulloch?

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Rennie's not coming.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: But I thought...

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: She changed her mind.  Let's see...Mr. Wolfe is in stateroom one-eleven and you, Mr. Robertson, are in two-twenty-five.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Where's the radio?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: It's...dead.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Christ...where's Rennie??

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: She's...she's dropping the anchors. I thought the Coast Guard could find us easier if...

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: What?? You sent her out there with a murderer running around loose??

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: The fire alarm...

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: She never should've set foot on this ship. This is your fault!

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: This is Jason's fault!

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Not another word, do you hear me??

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Dear Christ...

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: We have to get off this ship!!

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Jason's here in New York.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Don't be ridiculous!

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: All right. But if it mysteriously disappears en route, I'll have you sent back home the minute we dock. Understood?

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: Perfectly.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: What are you doing in here?

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: I'11 be coming around your stateroom in exactly fifteen minutes, Miss Mason. You'd better have your biology project ready or I'm phoning your parents.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: They're out of town.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Then I'll make sure you remain on board while your classmates see the sights.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Where did you get that alcohol?

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: I packed it. Just for us.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: That's it. You're not setting foot off this ship until we return home.

turns.speaker: TAMARA
turns.text: But I haven't even shown you my biology project...

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Hello, Charles. Has everyone checked in?

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Jim Miller and Suzy Donaldson never showed up. I'm a little concerned.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Don't be. They probably decided to explore each other rather than New York.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Let's go -- we're running two minutes late.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Charles, there's someone else coming along too.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: You have no right...

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: And neither do you. It's up to Rennie to decide what she wants to do.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: She doesn't know what she wants. She's never had a stable life.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: And she sure doesn't have one now, either. She needs to live.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: I'm her legal guardian, not you or anybody else, and I alone know what's best for her. End of discussion.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: No, I think it's just the beginning.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: She's fine, Charles. Take it easy...

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Oh, I can see that. You've done a wonderful job of supervising the kids, Miss Van Deusen.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: I thought I told you to stay away from her.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: I demand to know what is going on...

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Oh dear God...

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: What are you doing??

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: That lunatic has been spouting off about Jason since we boarded...  It's no coincidence.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: But that doesn't prove that he's the one!

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Walking corpses are not real!

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Did you find Rennie?

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: She's locked safe in her room, no thanks to either of you.  Has he brought it back on course yet?

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: He's doing the best he can, Charles.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: He's the son of the Captain, for Chrissakes. You'd think he'd be able to operate this thing!

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: I doubt very much that one even exists.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Use some common sense! Setting off a fire alarm causes panic...the same kind of panic caused by suggesting Jason Voorhees is on board.  Enough is enough.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: What did you do with Rennie??

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: Nothing! I went to her cabin and...

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: There must be a phone around here somewhere.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: A wonderful choice of places to dock a boat, Mr. Robertson.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Everyone split up -- we'll cover more ground that way.

turns.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
turns.text: I don't think that's such a safe idea

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: My niece's life hangs in the balance right now!! Every second counts.

turns.speaker: YOUNG RENNIE
turns.text: What a beautiful day.

turns.speaker: MCCULLOCH
turns.text: Perfect for a swim, isn't it?
